intro: Evansia nepalensis, commonly known as the Nepal spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. Its latex is milky and can be toxic, which is a common trait among members of its family. Evansia nepalensis is often found in open meadows and is adapted to the cold, harsh conditions of its native habitat.
